borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p><span style="line-height: 107%;">The proposed development, fails to provide a double bedroom within the
new dwelling and following the development, the living conditions and space
available for the existing property will be&nbsp;significantly reduced. The
development would result in&nbsp;an inadequate gross internal floor area for
the existing three bedroom family dwelling and provide insufficient external
amenity spaces and internal cooking, eating and living areas,&nbsp;harmful to
the standard of living and living&nbsp;conditions of current and future
residents, contrary to the development plan, specifically:</span><span style="line-height: 107%;">&nbsp;</span><br></p><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;
font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-fareast-font-family:
Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA">- Policies 3.5 and 7.6 of The London&nbsp;Plan&nbsp;(March 2016)<br></span><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies D4, D5 and&nbsp;D6 of the Draft London Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">Intended to Publish (December 2019)</span></font><br><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies BC2, BP5
and&nbsp;BP6 of the </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011)</span></font><br><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- The Technical&nbsp;housing standards -
nationally described space standard (March 2015)</span></font></p>

<p><span style="line-height: 107%;">The loss of the larger ground floor extension and introduction of a
second dwelling is to the detriment of current and future residents of this
family dwelling with the development resulting in a&nbsp;much smaller three
bedroom dwelling and a new two bedroom dwelling. This would facilitate and
result in the loss of a larger and more suitable three bedroom larger family
dwelling, a form of housing the council is seeking to protect from conversion
within the borough and something reflected within the development plan
policies. The proposed development is unacceptable in regards to the principle
of development and contrary to:</span><br></p><p><span style="line-height: 107%;"><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)<br></span></font></span><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">- Policies 3.3, 3.5, 3.8 and 3.14
of The London Plan&nbsp;</span><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">(March 2016)<br></span></font><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">- Policies GG4,&nbsp;H1, H2, H8, H9, H10 of the Draft London
Plan&nbsp;</span><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">Intended to Publish (December 2019)<br>-&nbsp;</span></font><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">Policies CM1 and CM2 of the Core Strategy DPD&nbsp;</span><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">(July 2010)<br></span></font><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">-</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;Policies
BP6&nbsp;and&nbsp;BP10 of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011)<br>-&nbsp;</span></font><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">Policies SP3 and DMH2
of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</span></p>

<p><span style="line-height: 107%;">The proposed development, by reasons of the scale and massing, the
disruption to the symmetrical and uniform nature of the terraces, a reduction
in the sense of openness at&nbsp;the junction with the banjo in&nbsp;the
shorter term views along Cornwallis Road and from Carey Road&nbsp;is harmful to
with regards to design and quality of materials and is&nbsp;unacceptable.
Further the proposed development will extend significantly beyond the building
line of the dwellings within the banjo towards the northwest, unbalancing the
street scene, harmful to the character of the Becontree Estate. This is
worsened through an inconsistent roof&nbsp;ridge line and set back at first
floor level, increasing the uncharacteristic nature of the extension,
increasing its&nbsp;prominence as an extension within the streetscene. The harm
caused is worsened due to the location of the site within the Becontree Estate.
The development is contrary to:</span><br></p><p><span style="line-height: 107%;"><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">-&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)</span></font><br></span><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The
London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policy D4 of the Draft&nbsp;London Plan Intended to
Publish (December 2019)<br>- Policies CP2, CM1 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy
(July 2010)<br>- Policies BP2 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide&nbsp;Development
Plan Policies DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies SPP6, SP2, SP3, DMD1 and DMD4 of the
Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020).</span></p>
description: Construction of a two storey, two bedroom dwellinghouse to the end of existing terrace including new crossover.

constraints_details.result: 123 Cornwallis Road, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM9 5LJ
